arguments.name: Nper
arguments.description: The total number of payment periods in an annuity.

arguments.name: Pmt
arguments.description: The payment made each period; it cannot change over the life of the annuity. Typically, pmt contains principal and interest but no other fees or taxes. If pmt is omitted, you must include the pv argument.

arguments.name: Pv
arguments.description: The present value, or the lump-sum amount that a series of future payments is worth right now. If pv is omitted, it is assumed to be 0 (zero), and you must include the pmt argument.

arguments.name: Type
arguments.description: The number 0 or 1 and indicates when payments are due. If type is omitted, it is assumed to be 0.
